intro: Osmorhiza geohintonii, commonly known as Geohinton's sweetroot, is a rare perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine by indigenous peoples. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
